test.name: Check ParticleKeffneutron_A to ParticleKeffneutron_B convergence with regard to the fine mesh BEANS solution

pass_tests.test:
from math import log
reference_keff = 1.00000100601
keff_one = ParticleKeffneutron_A keff_two = ParticleKeffneutron_B
mesh_one = 5 mesh_two = 10
expected_convergence_ratio = 2.0
keff_one_error = abs((keff_one - reference_keff)/reference_keff) keff_two_error = abs((keff_two - reference_keff)/reference_keff)
convergence_ratio = abs( log(keff_two_error / keff_one_error) / log(mesh_two / mesh_one) )
print 'Convergence Ratio:',convergence_ratio
relative_error = abs((convergence_ratio - expected_convergence_ratio) / expected_convergence_ratio)
print 'Relative error of convergence_ratio to expected 2nd order:',relative_error
assert relative_error < 2.0e-03
